alert.note: Alert for Fresno-Tulare Lower Sierra; Mariposa-Madera Lower Sierra; San Joaquin River Canyon; South End of the Lower Sierra; Yosemite Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 25 at 2:00AM PST until March 01 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON BELOW 8000 FEET... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON ABOVE 2000 FEET... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning below 8000 feet, heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to 11 inches. For the Winter Storm Watch above 2000 feet, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 18 inches possible above 2000 feet and 2 to 5 feet above 4000 feet. Winds could gust as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...Mariposa-Madera Lower Sierra, Fresno-Tulare Lower Sierra, South End of the Lower Sierra, Yosemite Valley and San Joaquin River Canyon. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 4 PM PST this afternoon. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Sunday afternoon through Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Fresno-Tulare Lower Sierra; Mariposa-Madera Lower Sierra; San Joaquin River Canyon; South End of the Lower Sierra; Yosemite Valley
